ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The experience will depend on the lab and PI.

I think rotations are extremely important. It is a good opportunity to see if you fit with the lab environment. Different lab environments fit students differently and it is important to try multiple labs in order to know what is the best fit for you.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Methodological insights. Introduction to coding and data analysis using MATLAB. Clinical experience.

This course was perhaps the most informative of the semester. I actually had the opportunity to design and carry out experiments to answer novel neuroscience questions which I feel is the most important lesson to learn in graduate school.
I found what I really want to do in my next few years.
Rotation research is really helpful for me to experience different labs to select a thesis lab.
It helps me to know labs better.
I learned to do electrical physiology and animal research, neither of which I had done before. I enjoyed my rotation work immensely.
